Question: What is the name of your OpenShift Container Platform project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this OpenShift project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What application modernization challenges are you trying to solve?
Guidance: Common challenges: Slow deployment cycles, Inconsistent environments, Infrastructure bottlenecks, Cloud vendor lock-in, Lack of developer self-service, High operational costs
Notes: Primary business driver for OpenShift investment

Question: What is your current application deployment workflow?
Guidance: Describe manual steps, systems involved, and pain points

Question: How many applications do you plan to containerize?
How often do you currently deploy applications to production?
Guidance: Typical frequencies: Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, Ad-hoc

Question: What are your primary goals for implementing OpenShift?
Guidance: Common goals: Accelerate deployment cycles, Enable developer self-service, Improve resource utilization, Support hybrid cloud, Modernize legacy apps, Reduce infrastructure costs

Question: How will you measure OpenShift success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: deployment frequency increase, time-to-market reduction, infrastructure cost savings, developer productivity gains

Question: What is your expected timeline for OpenShift implementation?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-3 months, 3-6 months, 6-12 months, 12+ months

Question: What is your approved budget range for this OpenShift solution?
Guidance: Common ranges: $100K-500K, $500K-1M, $1M-3M, $3M+. Include both infrastructure and services

Question: What is your long-term vision for container platform adoption?
Guidance: Consider expansion to additional teams, applications, and environments

Question: How do you expect containerized workload growth over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current container count and projected annual growth rate

Question: How many developers will use the OpenShift platform?
Notes: Developer seat count for RBAC and resource quotas

Question: What is your team's experience level with Kubernetes and containers?
Guidance: Experience levels: None - new to containers, Basic - using Docker, Intermediate - some Kubernetes, Advanced - production Kubernetes

Question: What types of applications will run on OpenShift?
Guidance: Common types: Web apps, APIs/microservices, Batch jobs, Databases, Message queues, AI/ML workloads, Legacy apps

Question: Are your applications monolithic or microservices-based?
Guidance: Architecture types: Monolithic, Microservices, Mixed, Planning to modernize

Question: What programming languages and frameworks do you use?
Guidance: Common stacks: Java/Spring, .NET, Node.js, Python, Go, Ruby, PHP

Question: What databases will you run on or connect to from OpenShift?
Guidance: Database types: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Oracle, SQL Server, Redis, Elasticsearch

Question: Do you need a private container registry?
Guidance: Options: Use OpenShift integrated registry, External registry (Quay Harbor DockerHub), Hybrid approach

Question: What is your target deployment platform for OpenShift?
Guidance: Platform options: Bare metal servers, VMware vSphere, AWS (ROSA), Azure (ARO), Google Cloud, IBM Cloud, Multi-cloud

Question: What is your expected OpenShift cluster size?
Guidance: Sizing categories: Small (3 control + 3 worker nodes), Medium (3 control + 6-12 workers), Large (3 control + 12+ workers), Multi-cluster

Question: What are your total compute resource requirements?
Guidance: Specify total vCPUs and RAM needed across all nodes

Question: What are your persistent storage requirements?
Guidance: Storage types needed: Block storage (RWO), File storage (RWX), Object storage (S3), No persistent storage

Question: What is your estimated total persistent storage capacity?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 1-10 TB, 10-50 TB, 50-100 TB, 100+ TB

Question: What are your high availability requirements?
Guidance: HA levels: Single cluster, Multi-AZ cluster, Multi-cluster active-active, Multi-region DR

Question: What are your Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO)?
Guidance: RTO: Maximum acceptable downtime, RPO: Maximum acceptable data loss (in hours)

Question: What networking model do you prefer?
Guidance: Network plugins: OpenShift SDN, OVN-Kubernetes, Calico, Cilium

Question: What load balancing requirements do you have?
Guidance: Load balancer types: OpenShift Router, External load balancer (F5 NGINX), Cloud load balancer, Service mesh (Istio)

Question: Do you need service mesh capabilities?
Guidance: Service mesh features: Traffic management, Security (mTLS), Observability, Circuit breaking

Question: Do you need to support multiple teams or environments on the same cluster?
Guidance: Multi-tenancy options: Shared cluster with namespaces, Dedicated clusters per team, Hybrid approach

Question: What CI/CD tools do you currently use?
Guidance: CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, Tekton, ArgoCD, None

Question: Are you interested in GitOps deployment model?
Guidance: GitOps tools: ArgoCD (included), Flux, Manual deployment

Question: What security and compliance standards must you meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST 800-53, FedRAMP, STIGs

Question: What is the highest data classification level in your applications?
Guidance: Levels: Public, Internal use, Confidential, Restricted/Regulated

Question: What identity provider do you use for authentication?
Guidance: Identity providers: Active Directory, LDAP, Okta, Azure AD, Google Workspace, AWS IAM, OAuth/OIDC

Question: What role-based access control (RBAC) requirements do you have?
Guidance: RBAC needs: Developer roles, Admin roles, Read-only roles, Custom roles, External user access

Question: What container security scanning do you require?
Guidance: Security scanning: Image vulnerability scanning, Compliance scanning, Runtime security, Admission control

Question: What network security policies are required?
Guidance: Network policies: Namespace isolation, Ingress/egress rules, Zero-trust networking, Encryption in transit

Question: How do you currently manage application secrets and credentials?
Guidance: Secret management: Kubernetes secrets, HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault, CyberArk

Question: What SSL/TLS certificate management requirements do you have?
Guidance: Certificate needs: Wildcard certs, Per-route certs, Let's Encrypt integration, Corporate CA

Question: What encryption requirements apply?
Guidance: Encryption needs: Encryption at rest (LUKS), Encryption in transit (TLS), Key management (KMIP)

Question: What audit and logging requirements do you have?
Guidance: Logging needs: API audit logs, Application logs, Security events, Compliance reporting

Question: What monitoring and observability tools do you use?
Guidance: Monitoring tools: Prometheus/Grafana (included), Datadog, New Relic, Dynatrace, Splunk, ELK Stack

Question: What centralized logging solution do you require?
Guidance: Logging platforms: OpenShift Logging (EFK), Splunk, Elastic, Datadog, CloudWatch

Question: What alerting and incident management tools do you use?
Guidance: Alert systems: Alertmanager (included), PagerDuty, OpsGenie, VictorOps, Email/Slack

Question: What backup and recovery procedures are required?
Guidance: Backup scope: etcd cluster data, Persistent volumes, Application configs, Disaster recovery testing

Question: How do you plan to handle OpenShift version upgrades?
Guidance: Upgrade approaches: Automated rolling upgrades, Scheduled maintenance windows, Blue-green cluster strategy

Question: What support coverage do you require?
Guidance: Support levels: Business hours (8x5), Extended (24x5), Full (24x7), Self-support

Question: Who will manage day-to-day OpenShift operations?
Guidance: Operations model: Internal platform team, Managed services, Hybrid approach, Vendor support

Question: What training do your teams need for OpenShift?
Guidance: Training types: Developer training, Administrator training, Security training, Architecture training

Question: What external systems need to integrate with applications on OpenShift?
Guidance: Integration types: Databases, APIs, Message queues, Legacy systems, SaaS applications

Question: What shared services do applications require?
Guidance: Shared services: LDAP/AD, DNS, SMTP, Proxy servers, NTP, Syslog

Question: Do you need API management capabilities?
Guidance: API management: 3scale API Management (Red Hat), Kong, Apigee, AWS API Gateway, None
Notes: API gateway and developer portal needs

Question: What messaging systems do you use?
Guidance: Message systems: Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, AWS SQS/SNS, Azure Service Bus

Question: How should OpenShift integrate with existing monitoring/logging?
Guidance: Integration methods: Forward logs to existing SIEM, Export metrics to enterprise monitoring, Standalone monitoring

Question: What OpenShift licensing model do you prefer?
Guidance: License types: OpenShift Platform (base), OpenShift Platform Plus (includes ACM ODF ACS), Core-based, Cluster-based

Question: What subscription term do you prefer?
Guidance: Terms: Annual subscription, 3-year commitment, Enterprise Agreement

Question: Do you have existing infrastructure or need new hardware/VMs?
Guidance: Infrastructure: Existing capacity available, Need new servers/VMs, Cloud infrastructure (IaaS), Managed service (ROSA/ARO)

Question: What professional services do you need?
Guidance: Services: Architecture design, Implementation, Migration assistance, Training, Ongoing support

Question: What are your priorities for cost optimization?
Guidance: Cost priorities: Right-sizing workloads, Autoscaling, Spot/preemptible instances, Reserved capacity, Multi-tenancy

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information

Question: What internal resources are available?
Guidance: Team members, roles, time commitment

Question: What is your team experience with this technology?
Guidance: Levels: None, Basic, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert

Question: What is your preferred migration approach?
Guidance: Options: Phased, Pilot then scale, Big bang, Parallel run

Question: What is your expected implementation timeline?
Guidance: Specify key milestones and deadlines

Question: How will you handle the transition?
Guidance: Communication, training, rollout plan

Question: What training will be needed?
Guidance: Admin training, End-user training, Documentation

Question: What testing approach do you prefer?
Guidance: Options: Internal UAT, Pilot users, Staged rollout
